headline: Easy Fried Rice
description: Transform leftover rice with peas, eggs, soy sauce, and carrots. Delicious on its own, or alongside any entrÃ©e.

video.description: A quick fried rice recipe like you get at your favorite Chinese restaurant. Leftover rice, plus a couple of eggs, baby carrots, peas, and soy sauce is all you need. Garnish with sliced green onions, if desired.
video.name: Easy Fried Rice Recipe

name: Easy Fried Rice
recipeIngredient: 1 clove garlic, minced, or to taste
1 tablespoon soy sauce, or more to taste
2 teaspoons sesame oil, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place carrots in a small saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a low boil and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in peas, then immediately drain in a colander.
Heat a wok over high heat. Pour in vegetable oil, then stir in carrots, peas, and garlic; cook for about 30 seconds. Add eggs; stir quickly to scramble eggs with vegetables.
Stir in cooked rice. Add soy sauce and toss rice to coat. Drizzle with sesame oil and toss again.

review.reviewBody: Horrible. Cooked it right even with soy sauces and teriyaki sauce. Still! Not the taste I was looking for. Try harder.
Good recipe overall. Scrambling the egg with the vegetables was a mistake. Added Gochujang paste and shrimp!
Super fast and easy. Better than buying it and a fraction of the cost if made at home.
Added water chestnuts bamboo shoots and bean sprouts
I added a little bit of my favorite spice and I loved it.

I sauteed diced onions, celery, carrots and peppers in a mix of peanut and sesame oil and seasoned them with soy sauce plus ground garlic, ginger and crushed red pepper. Then I set them aside, added more oil, and fried the rice. Once the rice was nice and "crisp" I removed it and stir fried some eggs that were seasoned with soy sauce and Gochujang. When the eggs were 1/2 cooked, I tossed the veggies and rice back in til heated through. Guess l got carried away but dang it was good and I thank you for inspiring it!
Very easy. Great taste. I don't like peas, so I substituted french style green beans. And I used day old refrigerator rice.
It was terrific and gone the night I made it. The only change was that I added shrimp.
Easy to make
Very tasty, easy and quickâ€¦will make again and again

Nothing like correct Chinese fried rice. No vegetables. Only ever use at least one day old rice, straight from the fridge. Never ever use freshly cooked rice. Only protein necessary is eggs introduced once rice is fried and hot. Never ever use pre cook eggs in omelettes shape, not at all authentic. You are welcome. X
I add pork, broccoli, cabbage (bagged slaw), onions, green onions, ginger, and a lot more soy sauce. Ginger makes a big difference.
Wow
very ez to make and tasty
We love this easy and delicious recipe. It's our go-to fried rice at home.
Wow, super easy and really good! I didnâ€™t have sesame oil I substituted good olive oil
I really enjoyed the recipe but I made a few changes by adding 24 hour marinaded chicken to the recipe
This was easy to follow. I loved the taste. Thanks for sharing the recipe. .

Made as directed and my husband said not like what you get at a restaurant. I think, although, he wasn't able to tell me what he'd change, think adding eggs to veggies and than adding rice it wasn't dry enough for our taste. Will make again, but will cook eggs separately and add at end. Flavor was okay.

I liked it but the others said it was just okay. I wouldn't change much tbh, just add something more to taste. Regardless of the neutral to semi-positive responses from those who ate it, I'd make it again for something quick.
Super good, loved it
Made exactly as recipe. Delicious!

I've made this many times with my only adjustment being to use frozen peas and carrots. It turns out excellent every time, and it couldn't be easier. I usually make the rice a day or two ahead. Sometimes I toss in pork or chicken. Great recipe!

This was fantastic! I used chilled rice as everyone recommended, but I just made it a couple of hours before and refrigerated it. I also used frozen carrots/peas mix that was slightly thawed. Don't be precious about cooking the eggs separately! Just throw them in like the recipe says and it's great. I used more than a tbsp of soy, pretty much like what the video shows. Finally, everyone is right about the sesame oil. You HAVE to have it for that flavor.
I have been wanting a good healthy recipe for rice and I found it
I added ham. It rocked.
Better than most Chinese restaurants And easy to make.

I haven't made the recipe yet, but as a former chef, I know that it's a pretty good recipe but, as others have said, rice should be a day old and cold. I agree that frying it first before adding liquids works better use with very little oil. To the person who asked what "season to taste" really means it is this. Professional cooks rarely just throw seasoning into a dish. They add a little, taste it, then decide whether or not to add more. That's how you season to taste. This is especially important with salt, pepper and/or garlic as too much of any of them can ruin a dish easily. Ignore the 5 stars. They made me rate it so I went with the most.
Tasted good. I think I made too much rice but we enjoyed it.
Easy.Quick. 5 star. I thought I'd screwed it up....but it was superb. thanks. Linda
This recipe was amazing, fast, and a great way to get rid of any extra rice.

I think it was great. And it was very easy to follow. The next time I make it I'm going to throw in a few onions. And I don't know what happened to my keys, somehow they disappeared into an invisible mush so maybe I'll try a different vegetable next time maybe chop up small pieces of broccoli or something? I'm so glad I tried this now that I know how easy and quick it is I'll be making it a lot more often. This time I made it with no shrimp or chicken in it but next time I'll add one of those. ðŸ˜ƒ
Easy to make and delicious!
Left out the carrots and rice oil but was still delicious

Great template for frig orphan ingredients - I incorporated a few mushrooms, leftover lunch meat, spinach leaves; things I had too little of to use for a salad, sandwich,etc. Made a single serving YUM.
I add better than bullion (vegetable) and dried onions to the rice when 3/4 cooked I too... scrambled the eggs on the side it give better texture

This didn't end well for me. I followed the recipe and got nothing but a heap of bland rice. I ended up having to add fish sauce and, once I added the pork I marinated in hoisin sauce, it improved--but this is nothing like the fried rice I have gotten from restaurants.
I added some mushrooms and onions. It was delicious ðŸ˜‹
This was so easy and tasty. The hints to use left over rice or refrigerate fresh rice were very helpful. We used canned corn kernels instead of peas. Will make again.
Quick and easy dinner. Already had rice in the fridge. Should have added broccoli.

This recipe is a VERY good starting point. I did take some liberties with the ingredients. I added Shaoxing Wine, MSG, fish sauce, and Mushroom soy sauce. I used a box of take out rice that was a couple days old and got a nearly perfect texture. Next time, I am going to try frying the rice first and then adding the other ingredients.
Quick, easy and delicious. I used leftover rice and reheated in microwave before adding. Enjoy!
Love this recipe! Tastes just as good, maybe even better, than at the restaurant!
I have made this several times. I really like it as is, altho I do use frozen peas and carrots and I use jasmine rice. This is comfort food to me.
This is my go-to base recipe for fried rice, very tasty and can throw in anything hanging around in the fridge
It was good but a bit bland, it's a good base recipe if you have an entrees to go with it.

I can't imagine making Fried rice with less than 4 cups of rice without it turning into a mushy mess. In addition, I find only Basmati rice or the US versiin, Texmati) tolerates the high temperature requured for frying rice
Quick, easy, and delicious. I added chicken.
Only change I made was 50/50 toasted sesame oil and veg oil (2T)

I used previously cooked rice straight from the fridge. Canned peas and carrots was used because thatâ€™s what was in the pantry. It came out good according to my hubby. I will be making this again. Itâ€™s quick and easy. Thanks for sharing

I didn't have sesame oil, so I substituted olive oil and sprinkled sesame seed on top. 
Oh sooo good!!!
Great and fast to make
can anyone explain to me about the the nutrients and the serving size.. does it mean 1 serving size is 261?
Great side for most anything. We served it with Chicken French.
Very tasty. I added onion .

As per suggestions, used cold rice, frozen peas and carrots and added 2 tablespoons oyster sauce and 2 tablespoons sesame oil. Not enough veggies for the amount of rice. Would double the next time. This was a delicious fried rice recipe.

I enjoyed this. Having not made this before and did a little research. I chilled the rice before as mentioned in comments. I also used frozen peas and carrot package with the understanding that they hold up better. Though I don't have anything to compare it to being my first attempt.
I added more soy sauce to taste. I also added a little ground ginger, onion powder, and salt and pepper. Iâ€™ve made this mane times, kids and the adults love it!
Awesome!

Very good instructions and an excellent base. I cooked the egg separately as a pancake, rolled and cut up. SautÃ©ed slightly onions and poblano pepper added cooked white rice and grated carrot. A dash of light soy and Ponzu citrus sauce. As I had them added chopped almonds. Went with Chinese Barbeque Pork (Chef John). As the pork had soy sauce that is why I went light on the fried rice. If you haven't discovered Ponzu sauce, do try. I often use half Ponzu and soy instead of all soy in a recipe.
Added some shredded beef to but overall turned out good.
Good recipe but next time I will definitely use day old cooked rice and fry the egg separately like a crepe, roll once done and slice before adding as another review mentioned.

Very easy to make. Cooked the rice in rice cooker and texture was good. For personal preference I added onions and green onions and next time I will add a little garlic. I was out of sesame oil but flavor was still great. Threw in some diced cooked chicken when I added the rice and it was delicious.
Served with green onions in top. Think I would start with sweet/ white onions before adding in veggies
Just added more rice measurements, turned out delicious!
Great way to use leftover steamed white rice!

This was a pretty good fried rice recipe that I "doctored" a bit. Additions: when heating up the oil and before adding the carrots/peas, I cooked up a few cloves of crushed garlic and some red pepper flakes. When the garlic browned, added in the veggies. Also added some diced ham (leftovers from Christmas Eve ham). Finally, after all was mixed together, I added two scallions cut up into 1" segments and cooked until just tender.

Great base! Definitely use cool/cold rice and more egg! I use grated carrot, frozen peas, and don't par-boil any veggies (also added onion and some Napa cabbage). Cook in order - meat (remove), egg (remove), veggies (remove). Fry rice and when fried/heated - add back in: meat (stir &heat), egg (stir & heat), veggies (stir & heat)- but add peas at the very end so they don't get mushy. I also don't use any veg oil - just sesame oil. Love using the red and green canned curry to season meat and rice (just a tad) - but everyone has their own taste. Thanks for sharing!

This is a great recipe though I unfortunately do not have all of the proper tools for it. I don't own a wok so I can't get it exact to the recipe but I did make it last night. I found that with the amount of rice the amount of sesame oil required was just a tad too much for my taste. Otherwise it's a simple and delicious recipe. Will make this again.

11/22/20 - to use up some leftover rice, I whipped this up, was a great first attempt! I used frozen veggies and about 50/50 of the soy sauce and oyster sauce, per other reviewers. I will definitely experiment with this and other recipes in the future!

I made this today on a whim with some leftover basmati rice that I made yesterday. I also diced some leftover chicken and threw it in. I used olive oil instead of vegetable oil. I chopped some fresh baby carrots and boiled them about 4 minutes, but I didn't have any peas, so I omitted those. The eggs scrambled up nicely in the wok, and the fridge-cold basmati rice and soy sauce blended in smoothly. The whole process only took about 15 minutes. I served it for lunch with some duck sauce, and it was great!
Very good and taste!!!!!
Slamming recipe. Another recipe in my arsenal!!

I made this for my boyfriend who just took it to work, called me and said I have to make it again! I took some of the suggestions and made this rice this morning and made the eggs separate. I also added a little sugar and salt free rice wine vinegar.
Awesome with shrimp!

This is a super easy fried rice recipe, especially good with leftovers. I happened to have some stew beef cubes, leftover carrots, an onion, and some celery--chopped & added all to the mix. It's absolutely delicious, quick, & indeed just like restaurant fried rice.
Great tasting, simple fried rice recipe! It is tasty the way it is and easy to modify for personal taste. Scroll through other reviews for good suggestions. Thank you for sharing this recipe!
Added some chopped onion and bean sprouts and chicken...yummmm

I had never made fried rice and I have to say this was easy and very good! I made it to go with boneless country ribs Asian style. I think next time I will add more soy sauce and as another reviewer suggested oyster sauce.

First time making fried rice. I combed through everyone's tips and tricks before starting. Here's everything I did for an excellent outcome: 
I put 2 cups of enriched white rice in a pan and heated the dry rice until I could hear little popping noises (stirring as it heated). Then I poured in 4 cups of chicken broth and cooked as directed on the package. I let it cool in the pan for 15 or 20 minutes before putting it in the fridge to get cold overnight. The next day, I scrambled 3 eggs and set them aside. I heated about 1/3 cup of veg oil in a Wok and added 12 oz frozen peas and carrots, along with 1/3 cup chopped green onions. I heated those through then added the cold rice and mixed well. Then I added 1/3 cup soy sauce, 2 Tbsp oyster sauce, 1 Tbsp toasted sesame oil, 1 tsp ground ginger, and 1 tsp minced garlic. Mixed well. Added the scrambled eggs and mixed. I let everything heat up and Voila! Really good fried rice! Will definitely make again!
I added chicken to the rice. Yummy.

Good recipe for American fried rice at home. I would not eat this at a chinese restaurant if it were on the menu... Peas and carrots? Maybe with sauteed peapods, water-chestnuts, bean sprouts, scallions and egg scrambled separately and mixed with the other ingredients.
Delicious
Made it and loved it! I served with store bought chicken egg rolls. YUM! I think this is a delicious use for rice leftovers.
OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!! Super quick. The hardest part was cutting the baby carrots. Lol. Definitely keeping this recipe on hand!
This was very easy and tasted great.I used canned peas instead of frozen, and should've waited a little longer to add them, as they got a little mushy. Great recipe I will make again.
No changes -- delicious

This recipe is one of the best recipes iâ€™ve made in my entire life. One thing i did though is add in some hot sauce since my family and I are fond of spices, other then that i rate this 11/10, love love love!!!
It was pretty terrible. I followed the recipe to the exact and it was horrible. Thought I could salvage with some Worcestershire sauce. It made it better, but still no bueno.

I replaced the water with chicken broth. I would rate this higher, but I left the pot on the stove simmering for 20 minutes and discovered that it was too long to simmer, which dried out the rise. I will try again, making sure to set my timer for 15 minutes.

I replaced the water with chicken broth. I would rate this higher, but I left the pot on the stove simmering for 20 minutes and discovered that it was too long to simmer, which dried out the rise. I will try again, making sure to set my timer for 15 minutes.
I recommend adding more eggs

Very good recipe.
I used a little oyster sauce and fish sauce for extra flavor.
I added some onion which added a lot of flavor. Also be careful with amount of sesame oil. 1 tbsp is plenty in my opinion. Your rice should be pre-made and cold before using.

This recipe was delicious! The original 8 servings with 2 cups uncooked rice was actually good for 3-4 people. Did some substitutions and tweaks: fried the canned veggie mix (carrots, corn, peas, green beans), added 3 eggs, mixed the low sodium soy sauce and sesame oil together before pouring just enough to the rice mix. This recipe was good with basmati rice. Next time I'll add in crab meat but it went good with Seapak butterfly shrimp.

Everyone liked it! My only recommendation would be to change the ratios....less rice and more vegetables. We probably used about a 1.5 cups of rice versus the 2 cups with more vegetables (and we could've still used more vegetables). That, of course, is a personal preference, but we opt for healthier when we can. Very easy and good though.

Great way to use up a bunch of leftover white rice from our Chinese take out order. I just added shredded carrots and the frozen peas to the rice mixture. Scrambled up the eggs first, removed from pan, then added a bit of oil and rice and fried up several minutes, then veggies, soy sauce and sesame oil.
This is an amazing food every bite I felt delightful inside.
Nothing personal but please when you post a recipe please post an appropriate photo. The photo shows bits of chicken and this recipe does not have chicken in it. It's misleading
